newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks steam ahead on strong foreign bids.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks steam ahead on strong foreign bids.

text.p: Caracas stocks surged as foreign bidders snapped up Venezuelan blue chips with food company Mavesa leading gainers in heavy trade, brokers said.

"There was strong demand .. one buyer completely dried up the ADR market in Mavesa shares," said Activalores broker Gustavo Alonso. Mavesa closed up 5.60 bolivars at 94.60 as 7.7 million shares exchanged hands.

"It's all foreign interest ... I'm sure next week we'll see a rising market," Alonso added. The 19-share index gained 1.37 percent to end at 6,585.58 as 77.7 million shares traded for 5.5 billion bolivars ($11.4 million).
Merinvest's composite index, which includes telephone company CANTV, meanwhile rose 1.33 percent to end at 103.48 points.
"International banks have been bullish about Venezuela an issued recommendations ... that's prompted foreign funds to take positions here," said one trader.
Venezuela announced last week it would extend by 18 months a one year stand-by program with the IMF that expires in July.
Among traded issues, 22 rose, 10 fell and nine closed flat.

Brokers singled-out gains in market bellwether Electricidad de Caracas, up 5.00 bolivars at 549.00; Banco Provincial up 20.00 bolivars at 810.00; and paper company Venepal A and B shares, both up 2.50 bolivars to close at 100.00 and 97.50 respectively.
